text: Hello again! Forgive the repetitive nature of this poll, but we think we got some skewed results yesterday because of the way folks interpreted the question. We would love your input on the following, even if / especially if you answered yesterday.
Thanks in advance for your participation!
i never click the correct button on this damn simple poll
i want to click the bigger numbers!
haha
Just to play devils advocate, what if someone is using multiple hubdbs on a page that have dynamic pages, would these settings be repeated?

For example, someone creates an "events" page where they have an event listing that is dynamic. Then under that listing, they have a "sponsors listing" where they list out some sponsors each with their own dynamic page. If these are both placed on a page editor screen using custom modules, would the fields you choose in the page editor go for both tables?
Yes you would have to ensure that column names are the same if you are using multilevel dynamic pages
That is an issue
man I haven’t even found a need to do nested dynamic pages like that. That sounds like inception
agreed, i havent found a need yet, but clients do crazy things and its not unheard of

You’re definitely right, and obviously I hope that eventually gets accomodated for.

I just can’t imagine what I’d need it for yet. I have pages that use like 5 HubDBs to do things but haven’t run into a need to like nest them that way. hurts my brain thinking of it

My thought on this all would be that when you enable a table for dynamic pages, it would simply show 3 additional columns `meta_desc (text)`, `canonical (url)`, `feat_image (img select)` aside form the ones it shows now `hs_path`, `hs_title`

The issue with that is whenever we would like to add a new meta tag, we would need to create a new column type. In addition, everyone that is already using column data to populate these fields in the template would have to migrate all their data over to the new column
Seemed easier to just solve the problem all at once and allow users to just select the column to use for all these values
thats a good point
But the nested dynamic pages makes a good case for the table editor
as long as there is documentation on needing the have the columns be the same name then i think that should suffice
maybe have one of those `?` bubbles with help text that link to it in the page editor
Issue is we have to store the data by column ID in the case someone decides to change the name of the column
